ResearchProjectDef.label: Fungus growing
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Specialized harvesting techniques allow certain fungi to be grown reliably.
A lucky man can stumble upon a treasure while an unlucky one can't even find a mushroom. Russian Proverb

ResearchProjectDef.label: Gardening
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Learn to grow a variety of decorative plants.
I must have flowers, always, and always. Claude Monet

ResearchProjectDef.label: Contained fire
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build a variety of structures to create light or otherwise contain fire.
"The most tangible of all visible mysteries - fire." - Leigh Hunt

ResearchProjectDef.label: Ice production
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build a station to produce ice, even in summer.
"Like ice beneath the sun's rays, to such poverty did he fall his fortune melted to water." - Ihara Saikaku

ResearchProjectDef.label: methodical research
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Establishing a base means of survival allows for further specialization and technological advancement.
“The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.” - Thomas Paine

ResearchProjectDef.label: short bow
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Learn to craft short bows, one of mankind's earliest machines.
"The haft of the arrow had been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes. We often give our enemies the means of our own destruction." - Aesop

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive armor
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Craft simplistic armor to defend against incoming threats.
“ARMOR, n. The kind of clothing worn by a man whose tailor is a blacksmith.” - Ambrose Bierce

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic traps
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build simple traps to defend against trouble or catch wild prey.
"Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall for the same traps or nets twice." - Saint Jerome

ResearchProjectDef.label: roads
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build roads and paths to move faster over the lands.
“Realize building a cobblestone path to your destination requires laying down one stone at a time.” - Jeffrey G. Duarte

ResearchProjectDef.label: bridges
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build bridges to safely cross water and difficult terrain.
"Who's that tripping over my bridge?" roared the troll." - The Three Billy-Goats Gruff

ResearchProjectDef.label: Fences
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build fences to hold in livestock and deter predators.
"If a person can build a fence around himself, he is bound to do it." - Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic cover
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Build simple barricades to take cover from incoming fire.
“Invincibility lies in the defense; the possibility of victory in the attack.” - Sun Tzu
